Detailed Description

Abtract Kernel interface. It defines the minimal functionality that should be implemented by a kernel. A Kernel is a generic objects that handles tasks. See also the definition of abstract task.

Definition at line 31 of file abskernel.hpp.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

virtual ~AbsKernel ( )
inlinevirtual

Virtual destructor. It avoids a warning for the presence of virtual functions.

Definition at line 38 of file abskernel.hpp.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void activate ( AbsRTTask *  t)
pure virtual

Inserts the task in the ready queue. It doesn't check if the task has to be scheduled and doesn't make any context switch

Implemented in Server, and RTKernel.

virtual void dispatch ( )
pure virtual

Checks if the current executing task is equal to the newly scheduled task. If so, does nothing. Otherwise, descheduler the old executing task and schedule the newly executing task.

Implemented in Server, MRTKernel, and RTKernel.

virtual CPU* getOldProcessor ( const AbsRTTask *  ) const
pure virtual

Returns a pointer to the CPU on whitch t was running before being suspended (NULL if t was not running on any CPU)

Implemented in Server, RTKernel, and MRTKernel.

virtual CPU* getProcessor ( const AbsRTTask *  ) const
pure virtual

Returns a pointer to the CPU on whitch t is running (NULL if t is not running on any CPU)

Implemented in Server, RTKernel, and MRTKernel.

virtual bool isContextSwitching ( ) const
pure virtual

???

Implemented in Server, and RTKernel.

virtual void onArrival ( AbsRTTask *  t)
pure virtual

Invoked when a task "arrives".

Implemented in Server, MRTKernel, and RTKernel.

virtual void onEnd ( AbsRTTask *  t)
pure virtual

Invoked when a task ends.

Implemented in Server, RTKernel, and MRTKernel.

virtual double setSpeed ( double  newLoad)
pure virtual

It sets the speed of the CPU accordingly to the new system load, and returns the new speed.

Implemented in Server, and RTKernel.

virtual void suspend ( AbsRTTask *  t)
pure virtual

Extract the task from the ready queue. Again, this function doesn't check if the task has to be descheduled.

Implemented in Server, MRTKernel, and RTKernel.
